hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: More Oversight In Public Authorities Bill

body.head.byline: By Michael Cooper (NYT); Compiled by Thomas J. Lueck

abstract.p: Democratic officials unveil bill that they contend will make New York State's tangled network of public authorities more accountable; Comptroller Alan G Hevesi, Atty Gen Eliot Spitzer, Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver and Assemblyman Richard L Brodsky combine parts of previous proposals into one bill intended to strengthen oversight of authorities (S)

block.p: Democratic officials unveiled a bill yesterday that they said would make the state's tangled network of public authorities more accountable. Comptroller Alan G. Hevesi, Attorney General Eliot Spitzer, Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver and Assemblyman Richard L. Brodsky combined parts of previous proposals into one bill intended to strengthen oversight of the authorities. A spokesman for Gov. George E. Pataki said the administration had already called for some provisions of the bill, and that the governor's commission on authorities would study the proposal.
